metadata.Title: CVE-2021-32556 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
It was discovered that the get_modified_conffiles() function in backends/packaging-apt-dpkg.py allowed injecting modified package names in a manner that would confuse the dpkg(1) call.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-32556` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

apport - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.24
apport-gtk - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.24
apport-kde - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.24
apport-noui - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.24
apport-retrace - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.24
apport-valgrind - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.24
dh-apport - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.24
python-apport - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.24
python-problem-report - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.24
python3-apport - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.24
python3-problem-report - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.24
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apport package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.20.9-0ubuntu7.24').
